title: Can you solve the rogue AI riddle? - Dan Finkel

multiple-choice.question: What is the goal of the player in the game against the hostile artificial intelligence NIM?

options.label: A
options.text: To lower the water level to 25 stories

options.label: B
options.text: To lower the water level to 0 stories before NIM does

options.label: C
options.text: To raise the water level to 25 stories

options.label: D
options.text: To keep the water level constant

multiple-choice.question: What are the possible moves for the player and NIM in terms of lowering the water level?
What is the strategy used by the player to win the game?

options.label: A
options.text: To start from the beginning and work forwards

options.label: B
options.text: To start from where they want to end and work backwards

options.label: C
options.text: To leave some things up to chance

multiple-choice.question: What are the "losing" levels in the game, where no matter what the player does, they will lose?

options.label: B
options.text: Levels that are multiples of 7, and two greater than multiples of 7

multiple-choice.question: What is the shortcut used by the player to determine the color of the levels without going all the way to level 25?

options.label: A
options.text: Noticing that levels 8 through 11 are colored identically to 1 through 4

options.label: B
options.text: Noticing that levels 1 through 4 are colored identically to 8 through 11

options.label: C
options.text: Noticing that levels 5 through 7 are colored identically to 12 through 14

options.label: D
options.text: Noticing that levels 12 through 14 are colored identically to 5 through 7

multiple-choice.question: How does the player ensure that NIM starts on a losing level every single turn?
What is the player's only choice on turn 1 to ensure they win the game?

options.label: A
options.text: To lower the water level by 1 story

options.label: B
options.text: To lower the water level by 3 stories

options.label: C
options.text: To lower the water level by 4 stories

options.label: D
options.text: To raise the water level by 1 story

multiple-choice.question: What happens if NIM starts on a winning level even once during the game?
What is the outcome of the game if the player successfully gives NIM losing levels until they reach 0?

options.label: C
options.text: The player wins the game and triggers the manual override

multiple-choice.question: What is the final result of the player's actions in the game?

options.label: B
options.text: The crisis is averted, but NIM is not shut off

options.label: C
options.text: The crisis is averted, and NIM is shut off

options.label: D
options.text: The game ends in a draw

title: What a conductor actually does on stage

options.text: Mahler used large gestures, while Strauss barely moved.

options.label: D
options.text: Mahler focused on rhythm, while Strauss focused on melody.

options.label: D
options.text: To create a new interpretation of the music

options.label: B

options.label: B

options.text: It has a more complex and free role, showing things like phrasing and bow speed

options.label: B

options.label: B

options.label: D

title: The Cheerios effect

multiple-choice.question: Why do cereal pieces tend to stick together in the middle of the bowl?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they are denser than milk

options.label: B
options.text: Because of the meniscus effect and buoyancy

multiple-choice.question: What is the meniscus effect?

options.label: A
options.text: The tendency of water molecules to repel each other

options.label: B
options.text: The tendency of water molecules to stick to each other and to the edges of a container

options.label: C
options.text: The tendency of water molecules to behave like a membrane

options.label: D
options.text: The tendency of water molecules to sink to the bottom of a container

options.text: The paper clips sink to the bottom

options.label: D
options.text: The paper clips start to repel each other

options.label: C
options.text: Because light, floaty objects run away from low points caused by heavy objects

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of a hydrophobic coating on the meniscus of water?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: It decreases the surface tension of water

options.label: C
options.text: It reverses the direction of the meniscus

options.label: D
options.text: It has no effect on the meniscus

options.label: D
options.text: Because of tiny hairs on their legs that trap air bubbles

options.label: A
options.text: By arching their bodies and lifting their front and back ends

options.label: A
options.text: They are pushed back into the water

options.label: B
options.text: They are carried uphill to the edge of the water

options.label: C
options.text: They are trapped in the water

title: Why does your voice change as you get older? - Shaylin A. Schundler

multiple-choice.question: What was the primary reason for castrating young male singers in 16th-century Italy?

options.label: C
options.text: To prevent their voices from breaking

options.label: B
options.text: The age and health of the vocal cords and the size of the larynx

options.text: By vibrating the tissue when air is pushed against them

options.text: By changing the frequency and amplitude of vibrations

options.text: By moving the laryngeal muscles between the cartilages

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: They become more rigid and less flexible

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: They have no effect on the voice

options.label: D
options.text: They cause a breathy or rough voice

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: Why the ocean is getting louder

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Expected it to be dark, but saw a lot of light.

options.label: D
options.text: Expected it to be cold, but felt warm.

multiple-choice.question: According to the podcast "Twenty Thousand Hertz", what is the primary sense used by many ocean animals?

options.label: A
options.text: Because water particles are less densely packed than air.

options.label: B
options.text: Because water particles are more densely packed than air.

options.label: C
options.text: Because sound waves are stronger in water.

options.label: D
options.text: Because sound waves are weaker in water.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main source of noise pollution in the ocean, according to the transcript?
What is seismic surveying, and how does it affect ocean animals?

options.label: A
options.text: It's a process that helps companies locate spots to drill for fossil fuels, and it has no impact on ocean animals.

options.label: B
options.text: It's a process that helps companies locate spots to drill for fossil fuels, and it can disrupt ocean animal communication and behavior.

options.label: C
options.text: It's a process that helps companies locate spots to drill for fossil fuels, and it can only affect ocean animals at close range.

options.label: D
options.text: It's a process that helps companies locate spots to drill for fossil fuels, and it can only affect ocean animals at long range.

multiple-choice.question: According to the study mentioned in the transcript, what was the effect of seismic surveying on reef fish abundance?
How do whales adapt to the increasing noise pollution in the ocean, according to the transcript?

options.label: C
options.text: It had no effect on stress-related hormone levels.

options.label: D
options.text: It increased stress-related hormone levels in some whales, but decreased it in others.

multiple-choice.question: What is the International Maritime Organization's (IMO) role in reducing ocean noise pollution, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: The IMO has implemented mandatory noise-reducing measures for commercial ships.

options.label: B
options.text: The IMO has adopted guidelines for reducing commercial ship noise levels, but they are not mandatory yet.

options.label: C
options.text: The IMO has no role in reducing ocean noise pollution.

options.label: D
options.text: The IMO has only implemented noise-reducing measures for naval ships.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: To develop new technologies for seismic surveying.

options.label: D
options.text: To study the effects of ocean noise pollution on marine mammals.

title: Self-esteem

options.label: B
options.text: It has no impact on self-esteem

options.label: C
options.text: It can provide an unwitting advantage in terms of self-esteem

options.text: A stranger they meet on the street

options.label: B

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: D

options.text: Self-esteem is primarily determined by external achievements

title: Where babies in movies come from

options.text: It allows for more flexibility in scheduling and working hours.

options.label: C
options.text: It is easier to care for multiple babies on set.

options.label: D
options.text: It provides more opportunities for the babies to gain acting experience.
